name: saute
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
to cook food in oil or fat over heat, usually until it is brown: Sauté the onions for five minutes.
More examplesFewer examplesHeat the oil in a large skillet, and sauté the beans and garlic.Add the garlic and jalapeños, and continue to sauté for 1 minute more.Sauté until onion and sausage begin to brown, for about 4 minutes. Start by sautéing chopped garlic in oil and gradually add each ingredient, cooking each a little at a time.

UK (also mainly US sautéed) used to describe food that has been cooked in oil or fat over heat, usually until it is brown: sauté potatoes Serve hot with sautéed broccoli and cherry tomatoes.
used to describe a pan that is used for cooking food in oil or fat over heat: First, heat the oil in a large sauté pan or wok.
More examplesFewer examplesServe with pasta, rice or sauté potatoes.Evening specialties include sautéed shrimp, burritos, chips and salsa.While the pasta is cooking, heat a large sauté skillet till very hot.
